heisig_chinese_memo: For an eternity sheep have been providing wool to make clothes for humans and give them a nice appearance.  Furthermore, for an eternity humans have thought of trees as having a beautiful apprerance.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: if the sheep (𦍌) is in the tree (木) for a long time (永), call him Mr
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This sheep tries to hide its appearance from the wolf by standing behind the tree.  Not a great strategy.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " wood ", " Yang " sound, the original meaning is oak fruit, after the usual " rubber " typeface oak fruit, "said the text": "Xu real from wood, Yang sound.." Xu Kai Department of Communication: "sample Today's popular books are used as oaks." Zhu Junsheng's general training: "Xu, soft, tussah, oak, a wood, in fact, is the same, also called the elephant fight, and also called the 梂."

After " like ", it means more style. "Jiyun‧Yangyun": "Sample, method." Duan Yucai's note: "Sample, the style used by today's people is the style word." "Sui Shu·He Chou Biography": "Whoever does something, He Chou Xianling Gen and Dagon stand in the same way. Workers at the time called it good, and there was no way to gain or lose."

" Like " can mean shape. Tang Dufu "Yang Jian has another twelve eagle painting fan": "Feng Shaozheng has recently been able to paint birds of prey."

" Like " can also be used as a quantifier to indicate the category of things. "Zhuziyu Lei" Volume 3: "The so-called gods, earth signs, and humans and ghosts in "Zhou Li" are actually only ordinary."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and "羕", the original meaning is oak fruit. Later, the word " oak " is often used to mean oak fruit, and " like " means more style.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「羕」聲，本義為櫟果，後常用「橡」字表示櫟果，《說文》：「栩實。从木，羕聲。」徐鍇繫傳：「樣，今俗書作橡。」朱駿聲通訓：「栩、柔、柞、櫟，一木也，其實為樣，亦謂之象斗，亦謂之梂。」

　　「樣」後多表示樣式。《集韻‧漾韻》：「樣，法也。」段玉裁注：「樣，今人用樣為式樣字。」《隋書‧何稠傳》：「凡有所為，何稠先令亙、袞立樣，當時工人皆稱其善，莫能有所損益。」

　　「樣」可表示形狀。唐杜甫〈楊監又出畫鷹十二扇〉：「近時馮紹正，能畫鷙鳥樣。」

　　「樣」也可用作量詞，表示事物的品類。《朱子語類》卷三：「《周禮》所謂天神、地示、人鬼三樣，其實只一般。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「羕」聲，本義為櫟果，後常用「橡」字表示櫟果，「樣」則多表示樣式。

Chinese: For an eternity sheep have been providing wool to make clothes for humans and give them a nice appearance.  Furthermore, for an eternity humans have thought of trees as having a beautiful apprerance.  
Meaning: appearance

Kind: traditional

從「 木 」，「 羕 」聲，本義為櫟果，後常用「 橡 」字表示櫟果，《說文》：「栩實。从木，羕聲。」徐鍇繫傳：「樣，今俗書作橡。」朱駿聲通訓：「栩、柔、柞、櫟，一木也，其實為樣，亦謂之象斗，亦謂之梂。」 「 樣 」後多表示樣式。《集韻‧漾韻》：「樣，法也。」段玉裁注：「樣，今人用樣為式樣字。」《隋書‧何稠傳》：「凡有所為，何稠先令亙、袞立樣，當時工人皆稱其善，莫能有所損益。」 「 樣 」可表示形狀。唐杜甫〈楊監又出畫鷹十二扇〉：「近時馮紹正，能畫鷙鳥樣。」 「 樣 」也可用作量詞，表示事物的品類。《朱子語類》卷三：「《周禮》所謂天神、地示、人鬼三樣，其實只一般。」
From the " wood", " Yang" sound, the original meaning is oak fruit, after the usual " rubber" typeface oak fruit, "said the text": "Xu real from wood, Yang sound.." Xu Kai Department of Communication: "sample Today's popular books are used as oaks." Zhu Junsheng's general training: "Xu, soft, tussah, oak, a wood, in fact, is the same, also called the elephant fight, and also called the 梂." After " like", it means more style. "Jiyun‧Yangyun": "Sample, method." Duan Yucai's note: "Sample, the style used by today's people is the style word." "Sui Shu·He Chou Biography": "Whoever does something, He Chou Xianling Gen and Dagon stand in the same way. Workers at the time called it good, and there was no way to gain or lose." " Like" can mean shape. Tang Dufu "Yang Jian has another twelve eagle painting fan": "Feng Shaozheng has recently been able to paint birds of prey." " Like" can also be used as a quantifier to indicate the category of things. "Zhuziyu Lei" Volume 3: "The so-called gods, earth signs, and humans and ghosts in "Zhou Li" are actually only ordinary."

樣字的基本解释

樣
yàng
见“样”。

樣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yàng］
［《集韻》弋亮切，去漾，以。］
“样1”的繁体字。
(1)形状。
(2)式样，标准。供人观看或模仿的东西。
(3)量词。表示事物的品类。
(4)抛掷。
[②]［xiàng］
［《集韻》似兩切，上養，邪。］
“样2”的繁体字。
橡实。即栎实。

樣字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　樣； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页551第05
【集韻】似兩切，音象。栩實。橡或作樣。詳橡字註。　又【集韻】弋亮切【韻會】餘亮切，?音漾。法也。【廣韻】作㨾。【唐書·柳公權傳】公權在元和閒書法有名，劉禹錫稱爲柳家新㨾。【長編】宋太祖謂陶穀曰：聞草制皆檢舊本，依樣畫葫蘆。【文獻通考】政和八年，令禮部造履三十副，下開封府舖戸爲樣。原作柳家新樣。

樣字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
樣字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yàng］
["Ji Yun" Yi Liang cut, go to Yang, to. ]
Traditional characters of "样1".
(1) Shape.
(2) Style and standard. Something for people to watch or imitate.
(3) Quantifiers. Represents the category of things.
(4) Throwing.
[②]［xiàng］
["Jiyun" is like two cuts, upper raising, evil. ]
Traditional characters of "样2".
Acorn. That is Quercus.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　-like; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 551 05
【Jiyun】Like two cuts, sound and image. Realistic. Oak or assembling. Detailed acorn note.　[Jiyun] Yi Liangqie [Yunhui] Yu Liangqie,? Yin Yang. Law also. [Guang Yun] For 㨾. [Tang Shu · Liu Gongquan Biography] Gongquan is famous in Yuan Hexian calligraphy, and Liu Yuxi is called Liu Jiaxin 㨾. [Long edition] Song Taizu said that Tao Gu said: When we hear the grass, we will check the old version and draw the gourd according to the pattern. [Document General Test] In the eighth year of Zhenghe, he ordered the Ministry of Rites to make 30 performances, like the shop under the Kaifeng Mansion. A new look from the original Liu family.
